channel.title: Loops :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: A loop is a command that restarts itself over and over while its loop condition remains true. Loops are trickier to analyze than if/else statements, because we don’t know how many times the loop will execute. The loop condition might be initially false, in which case we would skip the body of the loop entirely. Or, the loop might go through 1 iteration, or 10 iterations, or 100 iterations…we don’t know.
